result.execSummary:
The defendant Leo E. Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leo E. Gonzalez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leo E. Gonzalez was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Gonzalez, Leo E.

records.addlTxt: per Jasmyn @ ONSO - posted - Marathon County
per Brandi - in Marathon County- Detainer placed -warrant fee added

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 4:03 p.m. Defendant Leo E. Gonzalez in court.  Defendant states he got out of jail on 10/31/16 - has been working doing house remodelling. Defendant has payment plan application and $100 today. Court authorizes $100 monthly payment. Adj. 4:07 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on February 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Per Judge Bloom FTP warrant can be quashed, given a new review date of 2/13/2017 @ 3:00 p.m.
per Rachel @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

2:54 P.M. Defendant Leo E. Gonzalez in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Burns states agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Pfeifer/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Jail  - 120 days with Huber for all purposes. May serve in Oneida or Waupaca County. To commence on/before Monday, August 15, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Fine - $2,484, plus blood draw surcharge
Driver's license revocation - 28 months
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA assessment and follow-through
DNA Sample - Must check with Oneida County Sheriff on 06-16-2016 to determine whether DNA sample needs to be taken
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:13 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 1:44 p.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Burns statement to resolution; defendant intends to accept offer; had ride set-up for today and ride fell through - Requests adjournment to Thursday or Friday. Bail continued. Adj. 1:46 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:16 p.m. Defendant Leo E. Gonzalez in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:17 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:03 p.m. Defendant Leo E. Gonzalez in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:05 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
